title: Yoga For Hands, Fingers, Wrists  |  11-Minute Yoga Quickie
description:
This short session is the perfect moment to check-in and care for yourself! Today we focus on targeted areas that get stressed through everyday activity to combat carpal tunnel and weak wrists. This therapeutic sequence will reduce inflammation, increase range of motion in wrists, and improve flexibility in the small muscles of the hands, fingers, and forearms.

Bookmark this practice and repeat to release built-up stress in these targeted areas. Preventative care is the best care!

Let me know how it goes in the comment section down below!

Namaste.

* * * WANT MORE YOGA FOR WRISTS? * * * 

Try these other YWA videos for the wrists:

Yoga Wrist Pain Practice: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RGEWpPHu69A

Yoga For Healthy Wrists: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gb3_oSAGoXs

channelDescription:
WELCOME to Yoga With Adriene! Our mission is to connect as many people as possible through high-quality free yoga videos. 
We welcome all levels, all bodies, all genders, all souls!
If you're brand-new to yoga, check out my Yoga For Beginners and Foundations of Yoga series. These are designed to give you the tools to build a happy, healthy at-home yoga practice. 
Do your best, be authentic, and FIND WHAT FEELS GOOD.
Jump on in! You don't even have to leave your house. 

Love, Adriene

comments: Happy February, my friends! Today's short session is perfect for a little check in to transform your mood/energy! 11 minutes for CARE. Are you taking some time to care for YOU?

I suffer from Carpal tunnel syndrome in both of my wrists and its not something with much of a 'cure', I wouldn't consider surgery so tend to just live with it, this session has truly helped me, it seems to be the only thing that brings pain relief, don't get me wrong, when I'm in alot of pain with my wrists, everything hurts including Yoga, but this session is worth the slight discomfort because it works wonders, Thank you so much Adrian, you're my hero♡

I am 70 years old and used my hands a lot as a Firefighter and as a Service Technician. I had troubles with "Trigger Finger", stiffness and some arthritis with the fingers and early stages of carpel tunnel.  My daughter led me to your video "Yoga For Hands, Fingers, Wrists".  I just want to say this video has helped me to enjoy retirement and out of surgery.  Thank you , Thank you, Thank you. Neal

Explore day 2🎉 thank you, Adriene, perfect Sunday evening practice, my hands are ready for typing and editing on my laptop tomorrow, this will be an amazing practice for me to come back to regularly. 💖🧘🏼‍♀️🙏🏻
I’m shocked how much I felt that in my shoulders today!
